pages.title: The FileCaster
pages.text: There are several ways to play MIDI files with your instruments in MIMI but the easiest way is to use the FileCaster to play MIDI files that are on your PC.

pages.title: Opening the FileCaster
pages.text: To open the FileCaster Screen, first select it on your hotbar with your main hand or place it in your off hand slot. Then, simply right click while holding the FileCaster to open the FileCaster Screen.$(br2)You can also open the FileCaster Screen with a key bind ($(bold)$(k:key.mimi.midi.gui.filecaster)$()) as long as any FileCaster item is on your hotbar or in your off hand slot.

pages.title: The FileCaster Screen
pages.text: The FileCaster screen allows you to select a folder on your PC to play MIDI files from. First, enter the folder path in the textbox and then click the Load Folder button to load the list of MIDI files into the playlist.$(br2)When a song is selected, the MIDI Channel Assignments for that song will display on the screen.

You can think of MIDI Channels as representing separate parts of the song (like a singer, lead guitar, bass guitar, drums, and piano); Some MIDI Files may use up to 16 channels while some may only use 1 and channel 10 is always reserved for drums.$(br2)Looking at the channels assignments for a song will give you an idea of what MIMI instruments might sound best playing a particular channel for that song.

You can also change the Transmission Mode for the FileCaster to change who/what can receive notes:$(br)$(li)'Public' ('P') - All nearby instruments / receivers with their source set to 'Public'.$(br)$(li)'Linked' ('L') - All nearby instruments / receivers that have you as their source.$(br)$(li)'Self' ('S') - Only yourself and your instruments that you have set as their source.
You can close the FileCaster Screen once the song starts playing and it will continue to play as long as you keep at least one FileCaster item in your hotbar or off hand.

pages.title: Connecting Instruments
pages.text: To connect an instrument to your FileCaster it must have a Switchboard.$(br2)The Switchboard 'Transmission Source' property should be $(l:3_2properties#setsource)set$() so that is $(l:3_2properties#source)compatible$() with the FileCaster's 'Transmission Mode'.$(br2)The Switchboard's $(l:3_2properties#channels)Enabled Channels$() should line up with those outlined in the Channel Map on the FileCaster Screen.

You can close the Instrument Screen once your instrument starts playing and it will continue to play as long as you continue to hold it (handheld instruments) or remain seated at it (block instruments). This means you can play up to 3 instruments at the same time!$(br2)Play around with enabling and disabling channels on each of the instruments that you're playing to remix the way a song sounds.
